page.title: 07 A WALK FROM PANNAL ASH
page.content: There is a wide variety of houses between Pannal Ash Roundabout and Otley Road.Some are Victorian and have stone walls,slate tiles,chimneys and wooden sash windows.They don't have gardens but yards.The council houses have metal windowframes and brick walls but no garages.Their gardens are of average size.The more modern houses are detached with large gardens and picture windows,each house has a garage.Among the houses is a club house{(The Over Sixties Club)}built of wood and used as a nursery school during the day and for meeting various Clubs in the evening.Also there are allotments which I used by the people who have no gardens for growing vegetables.
